29 import re
30 import smbus
31 
32 # ===========================================================================
33 # Adafruit_I2C Class
34 # ===========================================================================
35 
36 
37 class Adafruit_I2C(object):
38 
39  @staticmethod
40  def getPiRevision():
41  "Gets the version number of the Raspberry Pi board"
42  # Revision list available at: http://elinux.org/RPi_HardwareHistory#Board_Revision_History
43  try:
44  with open('/proc/cpuinfo', 'r') as infile:
45  for line in infile:
46  # Match a line of the form "Revision : 0002" while ignoring extra
47  # info in front of the revsion (like 1000 when the Pi was over-volted).
48  match = re.match(r'Revision\s+:\s+.*(\w{4})$', line)
49  if match and match.group(1) in ['0000', '0002', '0003']:
50  # Return revision 1 if revision ends with 0000, 0002 or 0003.
51  return 1
52  elif match:
53  # Assume revision 2 if revision ends with any other 4 chars.
54  return 2
55  # Couldn't find the revision, assume revision 0 like older code for compatibility.
56  return 0
57  except (Exception, ):
58  return 0
59 
60  @staticmethod
61  def getPiI2CBusNumber():
62  # Gets the I2C bus number /dev/i2c#
63  return 1 if Adafruit_I2C.getPiRevision() > 1 else 0
64 
65  @staticmethod
66  def get_i2c_device(address, busnum=-1, **kwargs):
67  """Return an I2C device for the specified address and on the specified bus.
68  If busnum isn't specified, the default I2C bus for the platform will attempt
69  to be detected.
70  """
71  return Adafruit_I2C(address, busnum, **kwargs)
72 
73  def __init__(self, address, busnum=-1, debug=False):
74  self.address = address
75  # By default, the correct I2C bus is auto-detected using /proc/cpuinfo
76  # Alternatively, you can hard-code the bus version below:
77  self.bus = smbus.SMBus(0) # Force I2C0 (early 256MB Pi's)
78  # self.bus = smbus.SMBus(1); # Force I2C1 (512MB Pi's)
79  # self.bus = smbus.SMBus(busnum if busnum >= 0 else Adafruit_I2C.getPiI2CBusNumber())
80  self.debug = debug
81 
82  def reverseByteOrder(self, data):
83  "Reverses the byte order of an int (16-bit) or long (32-bit) value"
84  # Courtesy Vishal Sapre
85  byteCount = len(hex(data)[2:].replace('L', '')[::2])
86  val = 0
87  for i in range(byteCount):
88  val = (val << 8) | (data & 0xff)
89  data >>= 8
90  return val
91 
92  def errMsg(self):
93  print("Error accessing 0x%02X: Check your I2C address" % self.address)
94  return -1
95 
96  def write8(self, reg, value):
97  "Writes an 8-bit value to the specified register/address"
98  try:
99  self.bus.write_byte_data(self.address, reg, value)
100  if self.debug:
101  print("I2C: Wrote 0x%02X to register 0x%02X" % (value, reg))
102  except IOError as err:
103  return self.errMsg()
104 
105  def write16(self, reg, value):
106  "Writes a 16-bit value to the specified register/address pair"
107  try:
108  self.bus.write_word_data(self.address, reg, value)
109  if self.debug:
110  print("I2C: Wrote 0x%02X to register pair 0x%02X,0x%02X" % (value, reg, reg + 1))
111  except IOError as err:
112  return self.errMsg()
113 
114  def writeRaw8(self, value):
115  "Writes an 8-bit value on the bus"
116  try:
117  self.bus.write_byte(self.address, value)
118  if self.debug:
119  print("I2C: Wrote 0x%02X" % value)
120  except IOError as err:
121  return self.errMsg()
122 
123  def writeList(self, reg, list):
124  "Writes an array of bytes using I2C format"
125  try:
126  if self.debug:
127  print("I2C: Writing list to register 0x%02X:" % reg)
128  print(list)
129  self.bus.write_i2c_block_data(self.address, reg, list)
130  except IOError as err:
131  return self.errMsg()
132 
133  def readList(self, reg, length):
134  "Read a list of bytes from the I2C device"
135  try:
136  results = self.bus.read_i2c_block_data(self.address, reg, length)
137  if self.debug:
138  print("I2C: Device 0x%02X returned the following from reg 0x%02X" % (self.address, reg))
139  print(results)
140  return results
141  except IOError as err:
142  return self.errMsg()
143 
144  def readU8(self, reg):
145  "Read an unsigned byte from the I2C device"
146  try:
147  result = self.bus.read_byte_data(self.address, reg)
148  if self.debug:
149  print("I2C: Device 0x%02X returned 0x%02X from reg 0x%02X" % (self.address, result & 0xFF, reg))
150  return result
151  except IOError as err:
152  return self.errMsg()
153 
154  def readS8(self, reg):
155  "Reads a signed byte from the I2C device"
156  try:
157  result = self.bus.read_byte_data(self.address, reg)
158  if result > 127:
159  result -= 256
160  if self.debug:
161  print("I2C: Device 0x%02X returned 0x%02X from reg 0x%02X" % (self.address, result & 0xFF, reg))
162  return result
163  except IOError as err:
164  return self.errMsg()
165 
166  def readU16(self, reg, little_endian=True):
167  "Reads an unsigned 16-bit value from the I2C device"
168  try:
169  result = self.bus.read_word_data(self.address, reg)
170  # Swap bytes if using big endian because read_word_data assumes little
171  # endian on ARM (little endian) systems.
172  if not little_endian:
173  result = ((result << 8) & 0xFF00) + (result >> 8)
174  if (self.debug):
175  print("I2C: Device 0x%02X returned 0x%04X from reg 0x%02X" % (self.address, result & 0xFFFF, reg))
176  return result
177  except IOError as err:
178  return self.errMsg()
179 
180  def readS16(self, reg, little_endian=True):
181  "Reads a signed 16-bit value from the I2C device"
182  try:
183  result = self.readU16(reg, little_endian)
184  if result > 32767:
185  result -= 65536
186  return result
187  except IOError as err:
188  return self.errMsg()
189 
190 
191 if __name__ == '__main__':
192  try:
193  bus = Adafruit_I2C(address=0)
194  print("Default I2C bus is accessible")
195  except (Exception, ):
196  print("Error accessing default I2C bus")
